title: How do you play against Kayne?!!?!?
body:
I've watched a few Kayn videos on the PBE and honestly, he looks OP.

The people playing him have next to no experience on him, and just decimate and one-shot everyone. Imagine if they were Kayn mains.

But that's not the big problem. The big problem is Kayn's E (the one that let's him walk through terrain). Sure, you might think it's like Talon's E; he goes through a wall and you flash for the kill. Simple, right?

Except for the fact he can walk OUT OF SUMMONER'S RIFT (check NB3's newest Kayn video where he does this to escape a 1v4). Literally off the map for 10-ish seconds. How do you counter that? Even if you could damage him, you can't reach him since he's outside the map.

replies.body:
> Except for the fact he can walk OUT OF SUMMONER'S RIFT

In all likelihood, Riot wont let Kayn go live until that has been fixed. It's certainly an extraordinary issue, and I seriously doubt Riot would allow something like that.

> [{quoted}](name=HeartVine,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=j48iW9mO,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-06-30T01:52:07.591+0000)
>
> In all likelihood, Riot wont let Kayn go live until that has been fixed. It's certainly an extraordinary issue, and I seriously doubt Riot would allow something like that.

Have you seen that NB3 video where he excapes the rift !!! Literally

I haven't seen the video, but my point still stands. The PBE is the testing ground, it's designed to ensure things are ready for the live servers. Something like a champion being able to "escape the map" is definitely the kind of thing that the PBE is designed to find.

You play against him the same way you play against Yasuo and Zed:

You die to their team before they can reach you, so they can't get even more fed.
The ultimate counterplay!

Jokes aside though, _(or is it a joke? you'll never know...)_.
Champs have been ridiculously powerful on PBE and in development before, _(Syndra even has a quote referencing how completely broken she was before release)_ and they all _(within reason)_ have become fairly even on live servers.

All new champions are never perfect though, Camille needed to be nerfed hard, while Gnar needed buffs. 
Like HeatVine says, it's unlikely Riot will give us an unbeatable broken champ on release.
